item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Humans have a talent for escalation. -Death" -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Of all these the richest in beauty is the beautiful life. That is the perfect work of art. ~Waddington" -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by R.A. Salvatore
item.description: "There is a place within each of us where we cannot hide from the truth, where virtue sits as judge. To admit the truth of our actions is to go before that court, where process is irrelevant. Good and evil are intents, and intent is without excuse." -- R.A. Salvatore

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Hester Browne
item.description: "Fashion is a cruel mistress." -- Hester Browne

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "I used to think I preferred getting old to the alternative, but now I'm not sure. Sometimes the momotony of bingo and sing-alongs and ancient dusty people parked in teh hallway in wheelchairs makes me long for death. Particularly when I rememver that I'm one of the ancient dusty people, filed away like some worthless tchotchke." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "People disappear when they die. Their voice, their laughter, the warmth of their breath. Their flesh. Eventually their bones. All living memory of them ceases. This is both dreadful and natural. Yet for some there is an exception to this annihilation. For in the books they write they continue to exist. We can rediscover them. Their humor, their tone of voice, their moods. Through the written word they can anger you or make you happy. They can comfort you. They can perplex you. They can alter you. All this, even though they are dead. Like flies in amber, like corpses frozen in the ice, that which according to the laws of nature should pass away is, by the miracle of ink on paper, preserved. It is a kind of magic." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "My gripe is not with lovers of the truth but with truth herself. What succor, what consolation is there in truth, compared to a story? What good is truth, at midnight, in the dark, when the wind is roaring like a bear in the chimney? When the lightning strikes shadows on the bedroom wall and the rain taps at the window with its long fingernails? No. When fear and cold make a statue of you in your bed, don't expect hard-boned and fleshless truth to come running to your aid. What you need are the plump comforts of a story. The soothing, rocking safety of a lie." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description:
"A long time ago I learned not to explain things to people. It misleads them into thinking they're entitled to know everything I do.
-Sara" -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "..he continues to cling to the forlorn hope that I will turn into one of those swooning females...and fling myself squeeling at him whenever anything happens. Like all men, he clings to his illusions." -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "If you take a man by surprise, and behave with sufficient arrogance, he will generally do what you ask. -Emerson" -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Even a foolish old woman like me knows that lazy people don't think for themselves; they only think about themselves." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Wizards First Rule: People are Stupid" -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "You can't argue with the fools in the world. It's better to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Right and wrong are not the product of census." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Isola doesn't approve of small talk and believes in breaking the ice by stomping on it." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "The tongue is the most remarkable. For we use it both to taste out sweet wine and bitter poison, thus also do we utter words both sweet and sout with the same tongue." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Tawnya add a quote by Robin Hobb
item.description:
"All events, no matter how earthshaking or bizarre, are diluted within moments of their occurrence the the continuance of the necessary routines of day-to-day. -Fitz
Most prisons are of our own making. A man makes his own freedom, too. -Chade
When you cut pieces out of the truth to avoid looking like a fool, you end up sounding like a moron instead. -Burrich
We left. Walking uphill and into the wind. That suddenly seemed a metaphor for my whole life. -Fitz" -- Robin Hobb
